bioghist.p: The Philadelphia Stock Exchange was established in 1790 and is the oldest stock exchange in the United States. The Philadelphia Clearing House was organized in 1858, with seventeen banks as members. It was the second association of its kind in the United States, New York having established one in 1853. Robert L. Montgomery, William J. Clothier and George F. Tyler were the original members of the firm of Montgomery, Clothier & Tyler. The firm was admitted to the New York and Philadelphia stock exchanges in 1907.

scopecontent.p: The collection includes records of a number of Philadelphia financial and business concerns. The collection includes bound and unbound volumes of printed daily stock quotations and sales from the Philadelphia Stock Exchange, dating approximately from 1877 to the 1920s and from 1945 to 1950. Records of the Philadelphia Clearing House include: bound and unbound business volumes of runner's statements; daily records; daily statements; weekly statements (1864-1941); consolidated bank ledgers; and balance and receipts. Most series date approximately from 1858 to 1887. Other documentation related to financial concerns includes records of the National Bank of the Republic, including dividends book, representative accounts, bad debts accounts, and minutes (1865-1898); and records from the General Securities Company, dating from 1916 to 1927, which contain minutes (including articles of incorporation) and correspondence, including several letters to Theodore Roosevelt, Jr. Documentation of individual businesses includes a number of bound business volumes of Montgomery, Clothier & Tyler, dating approximately from 1907 to 1920. These comprise firm accounts, customer accounts, ledgers, deposit ledgers, and blotters. Additional records include: minutes of the Lehigh Valley Coal and Oil Co. (1889-1902); a Beech Valley Coal and Iron Co. stock ledger; minutes of the Radnor Development Company (1912-1923); Mary Binney Montgomery estate account book, 1917; and scrip, check, and credit books from the [N.B. & L.] Railroad Co (all blank except for several scrips from 1836). The collection also includes several volumes in German, labeled "Politischen comites der deutschen gewerkschaften": minutes and receipts and expenditures (1866-1944).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
